revised_title: Extended Shakedown Theorems for Elastic-Plastic Bodies under Quasi-Periodic Dynamic Loading
tldr: The author extends shakedown theorems for elastic-plastic bodies under quasi-periodic dynamic loading, considering structures subjected to periodic loads with changing amplitudes, mean values, and frequencies. The main effects in the dynamic case are the drastic reduction of the shakedown domain when external agencies' frequencies approach the structure's natural frequencies. The author provides a new simple proof of the second part of Koiter's theorem and discusses applications of both static and kinematic theorems.
scientific_discipline: Engineering and Technology > Mechanics of Materials
